com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad

Class ThreeAxisJoystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad.Joystick
      • com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad.ThreeAxisJoystick
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FilteredThreeAxisJoystick

    public class ThreeAxisJoystick
extends Joystick
    This class implements a simple interface for interacting with a 3-axis joystick. This interface was designed with the Logitech Extreme 3D Pro in mind. The buttons have been given names to avoid depending on their printed labels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreeAxisJoystick

        public ThreeAxisJoystick(int port)
        Constructs a new Joystick given its port number.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the joystick to be read.

    • Method Detail

      • getTwist

        public double getTwist()
        Returns the current value of the twist axis of the joystick.
        A value of -1 indicates that the joystick is twisted fully left.
        A value of 1 indicates that the joystick is twisted fully right.
        A value of 0 indicates that the twist axis is centered.
        Returns:
        The current value of the twist axis of the joystick.

      • getJoystickAxisState

        public JoystickAxisState getJoystickAxisState()
        Returns the state of the joystick axes together in a JoystickAxisState.
        Overrides:
        getJoystickAxisState in class Joystick
        Returns:
        A JoystickAxisState object containing the states of all the axes on this Joystick.

      • getThrottle

        public double getThrottle()
        Returns the current value of the throttle axis of the joystick.
        A value of 0 indicates that the throttle lever is fully down. A value of 1 indicates that the throttle lever is fully up.
        Returns:
        The current value of the throttle axis of the joystick.

      • getHatSwitchX

        public byte getHatSwitchX()
        Returns the current position of the x-axis of the hat switch that is on the head of the joystick (equivalent to a gamepad's D-Pad).
        A value of -1 indicates that the hat switch is being held left.
        A value of 1 indicates that the hat switch is being held right.
        A value of 0 indicates that the hat switch's x-axis is centered.
        Returns:
        The value of the hat switch's x-axis as described above.

      • getHatSwitchY

        public byte getHatSwitchY()
        Returns the current position of the y-axis of the hat switch that is on the head of the joystick (equivalent to a gamepad's D-Pad).
        A value of -1 indicates that the hat switch is being held down.
        A value of 1 indicates that the hat switch is being held up.
        A value of 0 indicates that the hat switch's y-axis is centered.
        Returns:
        The value of the hat switch's y-axis as described above.

      • shoulderButton

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button shoulderButton()
        Returns a Button object representing the shoulder button of the joystick.
        The shoulder button is on the side of the joystick stem and is generally pushed by the driver's thumb.
        Returns:
        A Button object for the joystick shoulder button.

      • hatButtonLeftTop

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button hatButtonLeftTop()
        Returns a Button object representing the left upper hat button of the joystick.
        The hat buttons are on the head of the joystick surrounding the hat switch.
        Returns:
        A Button object for the left upper hat button.

      • hatSwitchUp

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button hatSwitchUp()
        Returns a Button object representing the hat switch pressed up.
        The hat switch is the mini-joystick on the head of the joystick. It is similar to a gamepad's d-pad.
        Returns:
        A Button object representing the hat switch being pressed up.

      • hatSwitchDown

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button hatSwitchDown()
        Returns a Button object representing the hat switch pressed down.
        The hat switch is the mini-joystick on the head of the joystick. It is similar to a gamepad's d-pad.
        Returns:
        A Button object representing the hat switch being pressed down.

      • hatSwitchLeft

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button hatSwitchLeft()
        Returns a Button object representing the hat switch pressed left.
        The hat switch is the mini-joystick on the head of the joystick. It is similar to a gamepad's d-pad.
        Returns:
        A Button object representing the hat switch being pressed left.

      • hatSwitchRight

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button hatSwitchRight()
        Returns a Button object representing the hat switch pressed right.
        The hat switch is the mini-joystick on the head of the joystick. It is similar to a gamepad's d-pad.
        Returns:
        A Button object representing the hat switch being pressed right.

      • hatSwitchToByte

        protected byte hatSwitchToByte(double value)
        This method is used internally to convert the hat switch axis value of type double to a byte.
        Parameters:
        value - The axis value of the hat switch.
        Returns:
        A byte representing the state of the hat switch based on the given value.
